content.raw:
Ok more testing revealed new problems. When reloading a shot that has results from such a non ascii file you get this error:


```
#!python

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/janwerkmann/anaconda/lib/python2.7/threading.py", line 754, in run
    self.__target(*self.__args, **self.__kwargs)
  File "/Users/janwerkmann/anaconda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/zprocess/__init__.py", line 67, in f
    six.reraise(type, value, traceback)
  File "/Users/janwerkmann/labscript_suite/lyse/__main__.py", line 1671, in incoming_buffer_loop
    dataframe = get_dataframe_from_shot(filepath)
  File "/Users/janwerkmann/labscript_suite/lyse/dataframe_utilities.py", line 118, in get_dataframe_from_shot
    flat_dict = flatten_dict(nested_dict)
  File "/Users/janwerkmann/labscript_suite/lyse/dataframe_utilities.py", line 80, in flatten_dict
    flat = flatten_dict(dictionary[name], keys=keys + (str(name),))
UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\xe4' in position 5: ordinal not in range(128)

```

So we should better fix this first otherwise people can't open their files anymore.
If you want I can provide you with a h5 file that has the problem.


When editing dataframe_utilities.py you could also add two lines to asdatetime that make the function python 3 compatible:

```
#!python

def asdatetime(timestr):
    tz = tzlocal.get_localzone().zone
    if isinstance(timestr, bytes):
        timestr = timestr.decode('utf-8')
    return pandas.Timestamp(timestr, tz=tz)
```

Most of dataframe_utilities doesn't seem to like python3 I'm getting a lot of errors there concerning bytes and unicode. But thats not related to this pull request.

Ok more testing revealed new problems. When reloading a shot that has results from such a non ascii file you get this error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/janwerkmann/anaconda/lib/python2.7/threading.py", line 754, in run
    self.__target(*self.__args, **self.__kwargs)
  File "/Users/janwerkmann/anaconda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/zprocess/__init__.py", line 67, in f
    six.reraise(type, value, traceback)
  File "/Users/janwerkmann/labscript_suite/lyse/__main__.py", line 1671, in incoming_buffer_loop
    dataframe = get_dataframe_from_shot(filepath)
  File "/Users/janwerkmann/labscript_suite/lyse/dataframe_utilities.py", line 118, in get_dataframe_from_shot

    flat = flatten_dict(dictionary[name], keys=keys + (str(name),))
UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\xe4' in position 5: ordinal not in range(128)

So we should better fix this first otherwise people can't open their files anymore. If you want I can provide you with a h5 file that has the problem.

When editing dataframe_utilities.py you could also add two lines to asdatetime that make the function python 3 compatible:

def asdatetime(timestr):
    tz = tzlocal.get_localzone().zone
    if isinstance(timestr, bytes):
        timestr = timestr.decode('utf-8')
    return pandas.Timestamp(timestr, tz=tz)

Most of dataframe_utilities doesn't seem to like python3 I'm getting a lot of errors there concerning bytes and unicode. But thats not related to this pull request.
